oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Habits of the Hyena (L II.-9. 921-927, 928-930). The hyena carries off dead men and puts them in its hole for it and its family to eat, and goes to drink when the sun has set. 1) This story is found in Book II-9.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: About the hyena and its doings
